results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 012
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: Of great strategic and commercial value are the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, 1700 miles north-west of Perth providing an air-link between Australia and South Africa. The pleasant climate encourages outdoor life and sport of all kinds flourishes.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 007
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: Cherry trees yield a rich harvest; fruit pickers, sorters and packers handle the crop at Orange, NSW. Massed display of colourful dances at New Guinea, where five tribes gather; children learn early and adults decorate themselves with ochre, feathers, pearl shell and grass skirts.

results.title: Australia: the encounter
results.brief_description:
Recounts the story of Matthew Flinder’s circumnavigation around Australia, his trials across the Tasman, involvement with the Nagarrindjeri tribe and his encounters with a French explorer. The Aboriginal people clash with these “white ghosts”. On his way home to England, Flinders is imprisoned in Mauritius and his prized cat, Trim is killed. A decade later, Flinders returns home to his family. Meanwhile, the violence upon Aboriginal sacred lands continues.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia: secrets of the land down under
results.creator_credit: Chip Duncan and International Video Network
results.brief_description: Begin your tour of vast Australia in Sydney, then head to the Blue Mountains, where the squawks of wild parrots are drowned out by Wentworth Falls. Visit Canberra the federal capital, Melbourne, the nation’s financial and cultural centre and then travel across the continent to Perth. Watch the blazing sun paint Ayer’s Rock blood red and complete your visit with stops at Brisbane and the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: Australia: room down under
results.creator_credit: Westinghouse Broadcasting Company for Intertel and Dan Klugherz
results.brief_description: This American assessment of Australia gives special attention to our migrant programme and the subtle ways immigrants are changing Australia’s way of life. The question of the White Australia Policy, the contrasts of great cities and desolate interior, and to the arts and sports. Australia as it appears to a newcomer is seen through the impressions of a migrant girl in her unrehearsed discussions with her Australian boyfriend. Film includes interviews with swimming coach Don Talbot, filmmaker Tim Burstall.

results.title: Australia: per forza e per amore
results.brief_description: Giovanni was working on an olive farm as a teenager when he was suddenly called home - he was leaving for Australia in 2 hours! In this story he tells of his life since that day and how he became a political figure in his new homeland. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
